solution_line_template: First, we need to determine how many points Righty scored. To do this we perform {lefty_score}/{half_divisor}=<<{lefty_score}/{half_divisor}={righty_score}>>{righty_score} points since Righty scored half as many as Lefty did.

Then, to find the other teammate's points we perform {righty_score}*{multiplier}=<<{righty_score}*{multiplier}={other_teammate_score}>>{other_teammate_score} points scored, as they scored 6 times as many as Righty did.

We then add all three teammates' points together, performing {lefty_score}+{righty_score}+{other_teammate_score}=<<{lefty_score}+{righty_score}+{other_teammate_score}={total_points}>>{total_points} points as the first step towards finding the average.
We then divide this sum by the total number of players we're averaging, getting {total_points}/{num_players}=<<{total_points}/{num_players}={average_points}>>{average_points} points per player
